About

DataHack

DataHack 2015 is the first data-driven hackathon in Israel, designed to bring together the Israeli data community. Set to take place at the end of November, DataHack will host over a hundred data-enthusiastic programmers, designers and researchers, competing over 48 hours and combining their skills to build innovative solutions for real-world problems.

Location

DataHack will be hosted at the Hansen House - Center for Design, Media and Technology, located at Gdalyahu Alon 14, Jerusalem. The center includes exhibition spaces, an animation lab, theater performance space, a projection room, studios for visiting artists and the Graduate Programs of the Bezalel Academy of Arts and Design Jerusalem.




Theme

Like you may have guessed, the theme of DataHack is data. As such, every project is required to have processing and/or analysis of some interesting data at its core. It can be a machine learning algorithm, a statistical analysis or producing deep insights automatically with data mining techniques - we just want to see you do innovative things with data. Excellent mentors from both academia and industry will be present onsite throughout the event to help you tackle the challenges ahead.

Data

We are working very hard to provide you with access to interesting data sets. Some of those will come from sponsors, who might even pose specific challenges to tackle using their data. We have also partnered with the Public Knowledge Workshop to provide you with acces to data from public and govermental bodies. Finally, you are of course free to use any data set open for public use or for which you have free access. Have a data-related question? Contact our data team at data@datahack-il.com!




Date

DataHack 2015 will take place on Noveber 25th-27th, 2015. The event will start on Wednesday, November 25th afternoon and run until Friday, November 27th afternoon. An exact schedule will be announced in the near future.

Participation

Registration to the event is open to anyone - students, researches, designers and industry professionals. Applications will be carefully reviewed for skills and experience, and around one hundred applicants will be selected to form balanced teams of engineers, researchers and designers ready to tackle the challenges ahead.




Register!

You can register using our registration form here!






Who can register?

Any data scientist, programmer, designer, statistician and researcher - any person who loves data. You can be a student, an industry professional, or someone from academia. We don’t care. It’s best to come with at least some experience in programming, data science or design. However, you do need to be at least 18.

Forming teams

We welcome teams formed outside of the event and those who attend as individuals. The DataHack organizers will help you build a team where your great ideas and love for data shines through. Our registration process incroporates HakkaLabs' matching mechanism to help you find other participants with complementary skill sets to form a team with. Teams of up to five members are allowed.




Prizes

FAQ

When is DataHack?

This year’s event will take place on November 25th – 27th, 2015. The event will start on Wednesday, November 25th afternoon and run until Friday, November 27th afternoon. A notice will be given on exact times.

Do I need to pay?

No, participating in DataHack is totally free, and includes food and a place to rest.

What is a hackathon?

A hackathon is an event, usually lasting several days, where a large number of developers gather to work together on various computer programming projects.




Who are the judges?

Judges will be a panel that includes academics, designers and developers. We are currently in the process of determining judges. An official notice will be given at a later date.

What should I bring?

A laptop and a charger. It’s also a good idea to bring a sleeping bag/blanket/pillow. We will take care of the rest.

Are teenagers allowed to participate?

Unfortunately, due to insurance issues, participation is limited to ages 18 and above.





Data

Data is a big part of DataHack. You need some help with choosing yours? Intending on bringing your own data set or using an open one, but could use some advice? Let our data team know!




Data Challenges

Some of our sponsoring companies are not only bringing their own data for you to play with, but will also pose a specific challange for teams to tackle, and might even give out prizes for the best efforts. More details coming soon!

Data Sets

Teams participating in DataHack are free to use any data set open for public use or for which they have free access. However, we also want to offer you a curated list of cool data sets for you to consider.

To the datasets

Contact

Sponsor Us

Considering becoming a sponsor? We’re glad to hear! Please email us at sponsor@datahack-il.com, and our sponsoring team will work with you to find the a solution that fits your company.




Contact Us

Have a question? Need our help? Please don't hesitate to contact us with any enquiry at contact@datahack-il.com.

The Data Team

Data is a big part of DataHack. You need some help with choosing yours? Intending on bringing your own data set or using an open one, but could use some advice? Have a data-related question? Contact our data team at data@datahack-il.com!

Mentor

Have an advanced degree and research experience in a relevant field (machine learning, data science, statistics, etc.), and a couple of hours to spare? Maybe years of experience in manipulating data in the industry? Come and mentor our participants! To join as a mentor contact us at mentor@datahack-il.com.
